db:abstract.db:para: The ScatterSeries type presents data in scatter charts.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: The scatter data is displayed as a collection of points on the chart. For each point, two values are specified that determine its position on the horizontal axis and the vertical axis.
The following QML code shows how to create a chart with two simple scatter series:
For more information, see Charts with QML Gallery.

db:section.db:title: borderColor : color
db:section.db:para: The color used to draw the marker borders.

db:section.db:title: borderWidth : real
db:section.db:para: The width of the border line. By default, the width is 2.0.

db:section.db:title: brush : brush
db:section.db:para: The brush used to draw the scatter series markers.

db:section.db:title: brushFilename : string
db:section.db:para: The name of the file used as a brush for the series.

db:section.db:title: count : int
db:section.db:para: The number of data points in the series.

db:section.db:title: markerShape : enumeration
db:section.db:para: The shape used when rendering marker items:

db:td.db:para: The marker is a circle. This is the default value.

db:section.db:title: markerSize : real
db:section.db:para: The size of the marker used to render the points in the series.
